Side Effects: Weight gain and pm thirst.  If I get still in the evenings I will fall asleep 6-7pm
Comments: I took generic Avandia from Canada_ Europe_ and India.  Cost savings was dramatic. 100pills $199

Side Effects: My then 85 year old mother was told (out of the blue)she had Type II Diabetes by a PA after a high glucose reading; no one in our families have had diabetes.  No discussion- no A1C info provided or tested.  She took it for over a year and my siblings and I believe that was the start of her dementia symptoms.  She was told in August of 2010 by a specialists that indeed_ she did NOT have diabetes.  She was put on this serious RX when she did not need it.  She experienced headaches_ anxiety_ confusion.  She seems much better now OFF of Avandia.
Comments: This is a scary drug and doctors need to be sure to check to see if some of the old standby diabetes meds won't work just as well with fewer side effects.  They also need to truly verify with proper tests that patients DO actually have diabetes before being so fast with the scripts.

Side Effects: Extreme weight gain. Rapid heart rate up to 300bpm. Had ablation surgery about two weeks ago. Have already made a trip back to the hospital with severe chest pain and heart rate back at 200 to 300bpm. Not looking hopeful. May have to have another surgery. I have not taken Avandia since 2007. Been going back and forth to the ER since 2006.
Comments: I have not found a doctor yet to agree that it was the Avandia caused this problem. They are scared. Glaxo may have threatened to hit them with a lawsuit. My family has no history of Heart disease. I had a CT scan of my heart and was told that I have the heart of someone in there late teens to early 20's. Attorneys will not acknowledge because I did not have a heart attack or die. I was told to come back after I have a heart attack. My quality of life has changed drastically. I have not been able to return to work yet. May not be able to.

Side Effects: Avandia -- Watch PANORAMA ---
Comments: HARMFUL TO HEART ---

Side Effects: Massive weight gain that i can not get off. Can't walk for very long.  I requested to be taken off the drug 3 times before my specialist finally told me she was taking me off of it.  I have been off of it for over a year and still have the weight gain_ trouble walking and have certainly start having my heart race so fast I feel as though it is going to come right out of my chest.
Comments: This drug should be taken off the market before it causes more trouble.

Side Effects: swollen ankles and legs_ chills_ shortness of breath_ extreme tiredness_ could not walk more than 10 minutes without extreme pain in legs_ 35lb weight gain.
Comments: I hate it_ I wished my doctor had never put me on it. It was "KILLING" me. Yes_ killing me.

Side Effects: I started to experience chest pains a few years after taking this drug. (avandamet) I would describe the chest pain as heaviness and aching that would leave me with a feeling of anxiety. I would also feel palpitations and an irregular heart beat. My heart would speed up and then slow even when i would be sitting in bed or asleep. The pain would not be relieved by rest and would come at any time and last for hours sometimes.
Comments: I was having chest pains so severe one day that I checked myself into the ER. I was monitored and had an ECG done along with other blood tests_ but they all came back normal. I have been complaining of these pains for years to friends_ family and my doctors and all of them accused me of lying or exaggerating! I am so happy to hear I am not crazy! I got off of avandamet let year and since then I have been controlling my sugars with other meds.  The chest pains have started to die down a bit_ but they have not gone away! I'm scared!

Side Effects: Much weight gain and 2 MRSA infections.
Comments: A relative who is a research scientist for Genentec told me 2 years ago that this drug may not be a good one for me to take.  This was after two infections later.

Side Effects: RAPID WEIGHT GAIN_ PAIN IN MY CHEST_ EYES_ LEGS_ FEET_ JOINTS_ HANDS_ CALF STIFFNESS_ SHORTAGE OF BREATH_ STOMACHE PROBLEMS_ BLURRED VISION_ KNEES POPPING_ RAPID HEART.
Comments: I AM A FIT 27-YEAR-OLD_ 5'8 AND WEIGHED 127LBS. AFTER MY DOCTOR STARTED ME ON AVANDIA BECAUSE OF MY LOW BLOOD SUGAR.I DID NOT NOTICE ANY SIDE EFFECTS UNTIL A FEW WEEKS LATER I STARTED TO FEEL PAIN ALL OVER MY BODY AND STARTED TO GAIN WEIGHT RAPIDLY.GAINED 20 LBS IN 5 MONTHS. I GOT RID OF MY HYPOGLYCEMIA SYPTOMS BUT ENDED UP WITH HORRIBLE AVANDIA SIDE EFFECTS. I DON'T KNOW WHICH IS WORSE.I KEPT EXERCISING AND EATING HEALTHY BUT STILL PACKED ON POUNDS. FINALLY I QUIT TAKING IT YESTERDAY WAS MY LAST PILL. HOPEFULLY I WILL GET MY BODY BACK IN SHAPE.

Side Effects: heart problems_ lack of energy
Comments: I was taking Avandia for six months and was very disturbed when I saw the US Senate report that tied Avandia to heart attacks. My family suffers from heart disease and I had been feeling pain in my chest as well_ so I talked to my doctor and he took me off of it and put me on Byetta. I found a great website called dgmslaw.com/avandia that has some good information about lawsuits people are taking against the drug company

Side Effects: extremely tired most of time.  Much weight gain.  Hair thinning_legs and feet swell_taste buds changed.  Severe stomach aches every time I take this_ last all night.
Comments: When I first heard about the concern of Avandia side effects (2yr ago)and that anyone taking it should discontinue_ I took the article to my doctor.  She replied she was not concerned_ in fact she DOUBLED my dose.  I was furious_ but I figured she is the doctor_ she should know what she is doing.I don't see any positives from this med.

Side Effects: I have gained so much weight and I feel like it is mostly fluid.  My left ankle is swollen and top of left foot is very painful.  I feel as if I have absolutely no energy.  I swear I have been eating small portions and low caloric food but I keep on gaining weight.  My legs hurt in the joints.  I used to love to walk and now I get out of breath and feel as if I cannot go a step further sometimes.
Comments: About 6 months ago I told my doctor that I read the warnings about this drug and that I took myself off the medicine.  He told me that the Type 2 was more dangerous and convinced me to stay on the med.  I feel so terrible that I am taking myself off again until I see my doctor in April.  I feel awful.

Side Effects: With Avandia and Metforming:  Swollen right ankle_ weight gain_ chest discomfort_ sensitivity to the sun (pins and needles) . When taken off Metforming and put on  Avandia and Januvia my weight ballooned from 150 Lb. to 171 Lb. I was put back on Metforming but my weight never returned to 150 Lb. (I was eating small meals.)
Comments: Even though I clearly had classical Avandia side effects my now ex-doctor refused to take me off the drug. By the way_ he did the same thing with Crestor. I had terrible side effects  (shoulder_ elbow and left hip P-A-I-N #@%!). Since Crestor was not part of my insurance formulary he had to take me off and put me on Zocor. My pains melted away as if by magic. But I am not done with this so called doctor_ yet - for I am reporting him to my Insurance Company (Humana TriCare). I feel he is on the take(kickbacks from drug companies).

Side Effects: Very Fast HR 300+ Dig. With atrifibulation ER 4 or 5 times Cardioinvertion twice (padeled to stop hart) one atroablasion (arc welding inside hart)to stop atrofluter year ago still was going in and out afib stopped taking Avandia 2 month's ago no more atrofib???
Comments: Worst drug ever Unlisted side efects almost Killed Me not to mention weight gain and fealing tired all the time.

Side Effects: No apparent effects.
Comments: Initial 2000 mg of Glucophage/Metforin was not enough and Avandia was added to stablize blood sugars.  Never experienced weight gain as attributed to Avandia. Eating habits/exercise and aging have caused me to be placed on Janumet then Glipizide after 5 years from initial diagnosis to stabilize blood sugars but Dr did not want to increase Avandia due to potential weight gain.

Side Effects: Iron deficiency anemia. Atrial fibrillation. Forty pounds of water weight. Left lung filled with fluid restricting breathing. Congestive heart failure.
Comments: First 2 years the dosage was set at 2mg but my doctor was not satisfied with my average glucose levels so he increased the dosage to 8mg. I began retaining fluids and had two incidents of emergency room visits with congestive heart failure. Was hospitalized in the seventh year with the symptoms listed.  At that time I was taken off Avandia (Rosiglitazone) given blood_gamma-globulin_ and Lasix.  I strongly recommend this drug (Avandia/Rosiglitazone) be discontinued.

Side Effects: My Mother passed away after taking this med. Side effects to the Max. Not something I would wish on my worst enemy. Could it of been prevented if My Family And I were more informed about that drug avandia????????
Comments: I wish I would have known about the side effects with the propper warning!!!!

Side Effects: Weight gain; heaviness in legs.  Increased belly fat. Suspected it as cause of new muscle pain I previously did not have.  Knocking myself out trying to control weight and still gained.  This kind of gain is not how I normally gain weight.
Comments: Weight continued to climb in spite of increased exercise: 7 days a week with excellent diet control.  Lost weight when Dr. took me off it in '07 scare.  Blood sugar levels went up and he put me back on it.  Weight came back.

Side Effects: constant hunger pangs- 10 weight gain in 2 months

After taking 8mg for 7 months_ legs swollen to twice the size_ fluid retention_ heart flutters_ pain in all joints_ swollen knees_ severe weight gain 2 stone in 7 months.  difficulty in walking. Was taking 4 mg for 7 years symptoms started from then. As i have arthritis was told to get weight off_ so went on diet and exercise program still weight going on . After reading other comments i am not going to take rosiglitazone ( Avandia) no more.

I was just put on the avandia about 3 weeks ago along with 2000 mg of metaformin.  At first my doctor had me take 1000mg of metaformin and 4 mg of Avandia in the morning and then again at supper.  After 3 weeks I have such shortness of breath that I can not function_ I sit on the couch with my feet up because of the swelling and the inability to move without choking.  I have been off the avandia for about 5 days and i have already dropped over 10 pounds_ my ankles are back to normal and i can breathe.  I still have a little congestive heart tickle/cough but that is also improving.  My mother also took this drug 2 years ago and she about died from it.
Comments: If you are taking this drug be prepared to feel horrible and you may be risking your life.  I have had no improvement in my daily sugars in 3 weeks from this drug and when i return to my doctor in 2 weeks i will be talking to her about something less hard on my heart.

Side Effects: 19 pound weight gain (fluid) in 5 days. it.
Comments: BP went up_ leg pain was significant.  Diuretics (water pill) did not help.  One doctor detected possible cardiac (heart) impact.  I was lucky - it did not happen.  This occured about 6 weeks after starting Avandia.  Came off Avanida_ in three weeks total fluid retention gone and weight back to pre-Avandia days.  Will never take again.

Side Effects: Stomach pain and some swelling in the extremities
Comments: Tried Actos (gave me severe diarrhea and stomach cramps).  Then Januvia (didn't help) and a new dr gave me AvandaMet.  It advises you not to take anti inflametories while on the drug.  More than a year after going off the drug_ I still can't take ibuprofen without it causing severe stomach pain.  So I must take medication for the pain in my feet and hands.  Finally ended up on insulin.  Wish I would have started it sooner.

Side Effects: Right from the first dose_ my ankles swelled and the next day blood cells were forced into my skin tissues and my lower legs became cherry red.  I spoke to my doctor and she took me off the AVANDIA.  It is now over a year since and my skin is an ugly_ blochey brown.  It seems like it will take forever to clear up_ if it ever does.
shortness of breath heart beat was pounding right foot started to ache unable to perform every day tasks
Comments: under no circumstance should you take avandia for any purpose do not let your dr write you a precription for this drug. this all happened to me after taking only 16 4mg pills.if you ignoreall side effects listed on this site you will regret it

Side Effects: None
Comments: Fairly effective but blood sugar always tends to be higher than desirable. Because of heart concerns switched to Januvia but not certain it works any better or even as well.The most effective drug I ever used was the now banished Rezulin.

Side Effects: I have been taking Avandia for 8 years now.  My legs are double in size now_ even though I am taking a water pill.  My knees are constantly swollen_ and very painful.  I had an MRI done on them in July_ 2007 because my PCP thought I had a tumor growing out the side of my knee.  It was "subcutaneous" fat cells and I suspect it is from the Avandia.  I have gained a lot of weight in the past 8 years_ and have tried diet after diet.  I have also been diagnosed with Arthritis_ because of the pain in my legs_ arms_ muscles.  I suspect that is all from the Avandia also.  I tried other meds and none have worked for me like the Avandia_ so my doctor keeps me on it.  The Amaryl put me into a diabetic coma after 1 week_ and Glucophage didn't work at all.  I tried many others.  I take 8 mgs. daily.

Avandia did help reduce water retention.  However_ I experienced excessive weight gain_ constant pain in the bottoms of both feet_ and heaviness in both legs.  Once I stopped taking this med_ these symptoms disappeared.
SWELLING EVERYWHERE
Comments: I was a human water balloon even on strong diuretics they kept playing with. My BP zoomed and they put me on meds for it.  Nothing stopped the swelling.  It hurt to walk on my tree stump ankles.  My doctor warned me about the swelling but nothing else on the market has worked for me.  I went back on glucophage and I live now with GI distress but at least I can wear strappy heels again and I can move without the pain of swelling.  Do Not Try This Medication.  It isn't worth it and nothing can be done to stop the intense swelling-not diet and not meds. luckily I quit before I had more health problems as a result.

Side Effects: weight gain!!  I gained about 30 pounds in one year
Comments: since stopping it_ I have lost 23 pounds in 13 months with no chane in eating habits.

Side Effects: edema (swelling of the arms and legs)_ hair thinning and loss_ swelling of the eyeballs_ rapid weight gain_ high blood pressure_ high cholesterol
Comments: After a spike in my A1c test_ my doctor suggested Avandia and gave me some samples at first and eventually he wrote me a perscription. I had been working out and had lost 65 pounds (which could have accounted for the spike in my A1c level). After 1-1/2 years of taking Avandia_ I had gained all of the weight back plus 10 pounds( I was still exercising 3x a week and eating the same). I had to get my glasses changed twice in a year because my vision had changed (due to the swelling of my eyes). My hair was thinning and falling out. My legs began swelling up. Was told at first that it was due to arthritis or overuse and then it was because of high blood pressure. They put me on a "water" pill to bring down the swelling. It didn't...in fact it made my blood pressure increase.  They then tried to put me on cholesterol medication. This is when I said enough. I started doing my own research and found this website. I was seeing up to 4 or 5 different doctors and none of them even shar

Side Effects: I didn't realize it at the time_ but actually caused sever stomach pain which lead to an endoscopy. Couldn't eat spicy foods. Was told my stomach lining was severly inflammed. I stopped avandia about 6 months of this_ and all the sudden all my stomach problems stopped. Haven't had any since then.
itching_ swelling _extended abdomine_ rash_ head aches_severe back pain and legs. extreme pain all over and chills.
Comments: also was hospitolized about 6 months after starting medication with 2 TIA's.

Side Effects: before taking avandia I was on a weightloss success_ 3 weeks after I was put onto avandia(4mg 1xday)with my metformin(500mg? 3xday)-(1 yr) I gained 15 lbs_ my legs felt like lead weights_ with water retention in my ankles and feet_ and have stayed that way since. 03/25/07 to 02/03/08. I wasn't able to dance at my cousin's wedding and my Mom just didn't understand_ she was very upset with me. I really hate how my belly looks pregnant_ pants don't fit right_ weight loss is non-exsistant even with a strict diet.
Comments: with all the scares in the news media over the last year_ I'm waiting for some tests at the end of february. I'll decide then to be my own Dr. and halve the 4 mg to 2mg avandia 1xday and then in time ween myself off.

Side Effects: swelling of feet and legs_ weight gain_ heart palpations_shortness of breath
Comments: I actually thought I was slowly dying!  We moved to a new area and new doctor took me off Avandia yesterday!  This is a scary drug and should be removed.  I hope to be able to walk and breath normal soon!

Reason: I am a Type II Diabetic
Side Effects: I suffered a heart attack_ weight gain_ which I have now lost_ since being off of Avandia_ and edema.  My legs and ankles were swollen for years_ doctors attributing it to heart condition.  When I stopped taking the Avandia_ the swelling disappeared within one week.
accelerating weight gainheart palpitations
Comments: The more I restricted calories the more I seemed to gain.  My blood glucose was well-controlled but when I had gained 130 pounds I walked away from the doctor that was prescribing it. I've lost all that I gained (and more) by switching to insulin_ diet_ and exercise.

Side Effects: sore/swollen feet_ calf muscles tight_short of breath_ blurred vision. couldnt lose weight as i started working out in ladys gym 5 days a week and watched my diet.
Comments: only by chance i stopped taking avandia and within a day my feet no longer hurt me. my vision has improved. i am not taking this drug anymore and just increase my diaphormine to help keep sugars down. not worth taking this drug. side effects are worse then the actual help of keeping sugar levels down. i think more exercise and lower carb intake will help.

Side Effects: Steady weight gain_ water retention_ bone density loss_ heart palpitations_ chest pain.
Comments: When I got off the drug_ I lost 15 pounds in 4 weeks and the heart palpitations stopped. I found out Avandia makes cosmetic improvements to blood sugar readings by converting bone stem cells in to hungry new baby fat cells that love blood glucose -- but with bad long-term affects on blood lipids_ obesity_ bone density_ heart health.  Not worth it.

Side Effects: I started taking Actos_ Had weigh gain and holding water. I asked to be taken off of it. My doctor switched me to Avandia.  SAME TYPE OF MEDICINE_ DIFFERANT NAME. Same symptoms_ legs and feet swelling_ hard to walk_ gained about 30 #s in one year. Doc said you are eating too much" I said "no_ it's Avandia. I became weaker_ irregular and fast heartbeats. In Dec._05 went to emergency room with Heart Failure_ Doc kept me on Avandia. On July 17_2007 Doc increased my Avandia to 8 milligrams and told me to take insulin with it. I decided_ NO MORE_ with hearing all the news about its safety.
Comments: In Sept_2007 I went to a diabetes specialist and he took me off Avandia immediately. A week later my blood sugar has not gone up without Avandia. I don't know how things will go from here but it is too late for me to repair my heart failure. The only thing that I would say is_ Do a lot of research FOR SIDE EFFECTS_ IF YOU DON'T FEEL WELL AFTER TAKING A MEDICINE_ GET A SECOND OR THIRD OPINION _ before it is too late.

Side Effects: Sporadic intense flushing and sweats_ sometimes as many as 15 a day. Rapid weight gain_ extreme tiredness_ and swelling hands and feet
Comments: My doctor kept telling me there was nothing wrong with avandamet_ and after exhaustive tests to determine the cause of my sensation of being on fire 15 times a day_ after reading the forums here i told my doctor i refused to take it any more. i stopped avandamet 2 days ago and have been prescibed janumet_ 1000 mg 2 times a day and the sweats stopped immediately. i've been on the new regimen for 3 days now with no side effects so far. I feel rejuvenated and much better. If I had listened to my doctor i would still be burning up while more tests are run. sweats started 6 mos. ago after being on the drug for 1-1/2 yrs. I also had a stent put in my left anterior descending artery last yr. i'm wondering now if avandamet might have helped that along since i'm only 51. I would urge anyone who has been having problems with this nasty drug to ask for another alternative.

Side Effects: Swollen painful feet and legs_ Shortness of breath.  Did not realize how short of breath I was until I came within inches of drowning.  I turned over in a canoe in very deep water.  When I came up the canoe was twenty feet away and floating upside down with one life preserver and 3 seat cushion preservers under it.  Foolishly I was not wearing one.  I swam towards the canoe.  I was immediately gasping for air. By the time I got within two feet of the canoe I was completely exhausted_ out of breath and could no longer keep my face above water. I managed to reach out and grasp the rail of the canoe_ barely having the strength to hang on_ gasping for air. If the canoe had been two or three feet further away_ I truly believe I would have drowned.  If I had went down one more time I would not have the strength to swim back to the surface. A very scary situation! I am asking my doctor to take me off Avandia.

I was diagnosed with type II diabetes in January 2004 and started treatment with Avandamet in March 04.  I am an avid bicyclist and continued cycling as a routine form of exercise.  In November of 2006 I started running in hopes of building up to a marathon by the summer of 2007.  Between February 2007 and May 2007 I completed three half marathons.  In late June 2007 my ankles and lower legs started swelling. I tried to run and was only able to make it about 300 yards before running out of breath.  Additionally_ my systolic pressure jumped approx 35 points.   A routine nuclear stress test demonstrated an  abnormal EKG and some artery blockage. My regulary doctor  took me off Avandament and prescribed Janumet.  Withing a week the swelling went away.  Due to the abnormal stress test_ EKG and shortness of breath the cardiologist did a cardio cath.  The cardio cath verified the blockage 30% to 40% in the lower portion of the Anterior decending artery and no other blockage or prob
Comments: I believe the avandia did a good job keeping my glucose in check.  However_ I believe the swelling was caused by the avandia.  I spoke to a doctor at the intake before the cardio cath and was advised a drug can be tollerated for years but_ then cause an allergenic reaction. SIDE COMMENT:  Cardio caths are painful.

Side Effects: Shortage of breath and some water retention. HEART FAILURE?
Comments: My doctor prescribe the medicine to improve my HbA1c. I did notice some improvement but not until Januvia was added to the mix. I did not have any concern until I developed heart failure and my heart doctor can not determine the cause. I'm not sure if it is the medicine that cause it but I got off Avandia at my request because of all the bad publicity it receive recently. Believe it or not my doctor put me on Actos. He knew I had heart failure_ so I'm even more confused of what he was thinking since this medicine warning states if you have heart failure you should not be taking it. I'm changing doctors. I was unaware of the issue of heart failure until I heard it on television last month. I recommend that anyone that is put on this medicine be closely monitor. If they notice any signs of water retention_ shortage of breath or being extremly tired_ I would talk to their doctor immdiately about changing to another medicine.

Side Effects: took it for 3 months had lost 30 pounds before taking it and put most of it back on in the 2 months. lost energy_ depressed_ no energy_ doctor gave me a pnuemonia shot_ and put me on oxygen at night.sugars were good though_ then my eyesight started getting weird couldn't see at times i had blurred spots in my vision then i heard about the scare and my doctor is hard to get into so i quit taking the avandaryl and stuck with my metformin in 3 days my breathing was better and after a month i am getting some energy back. my eyesight was also greatly improved after just being off it for a couple of days. I really felt like i was going downhill a little more each day. I do not agree with the use of this medication
weight gain of 40 lbs. hungry all of the time_ very tiredhave now been diagnosed with osteo-arthritis_ muscle soreness also
Comments: after the news scare my Doctor told me to stop taking it_after a few weeks I am now experiencing a lot of sweating_ it comes from the top of my head and drips like a tap after hardly any exertion.

Side Effects: None
Comments: So far after a few years_ no side affects_ but compared to other medication_ it doesn't seem to help much either. Also_ if my health plan didn't have a prescription benefit_ I couldn't afford it.

Side Effects: I acquired what looks like a "tumor" of fat.  My gut just kept growing after a total of 7 years--6 on avandia and one on avandaryl.It was the avandaryl that caused the huge weight gain.  I would say nearly 35 pounds in one year.  Unfortunately_ this web site does not list Avandaryl as one of its drugs to rate.My mother finally said that I looked odd_ that the fat didn't look like fat from overeating.  and I do NOT overeat!!I have this distended stomach and now my hips are widening!
Comments: It is ironic that if "one" is diabetic_ weight loss is the most important thing one can do.Yet here we have a pill for disbetes that causes one to gain even more weight.One might think that the drug manufacturer wanted "cusotmers" to gain weight so they would need to keep taking the drug.But_ surely_ drug companies care about our best interests_ right?  They would never hurt us so they could make a profit_ would they??!!

Side Effects: unsatiable hunger/always felt hungry; no energy; fatigued_ sluggishness_ always tired; absolutely exhausted for no reason at all; swelling; bloated feeling; breathing got much worse - was very very short of breath; even going up one set of stairs caused heavy shortness of breath; I went to a different doctor for breathing problems which weren't that bad before Avandia; very blurry eyes at times; tired eyes a lot of times - my eyes felt like I'd been up 24 hrs or so yet I was getting enough sleep; ongoing very blurry vision; legs were SO HEAVY and TIRED constantly - from nothing; felt insecure on my feet - like I might trip and fall and I didn't know why 'til I stopped taking Avandia. Depressed for no reason at all; this was ongoing; down in the dumps feeling a majority of the time.  Peripheral neuropathy seems to be worse - only had it slightly in one toe previously; some muscle pain for no reason;
Comments: I just went to my endochronologist.  I had stopped taking Avandia 1 wk before the warnings came out because of how bad I was feeling and the excessive weight gain. I had managed to lose some weight prior to Avandia. He still thinks Avandia is great since "it hasn't been proven yet".  I don't want to keep taking it 'til I have a heart attack or other health problems.  Avandia has too many side effects.  Who knows if they'll be the next victim of Avandia?  Why take the risk?  There has to be better medications!  Had a family friend who died from Vioxx caused heart attack.  She died shortly after Dr. gave her Vioxx.  I don't think Avandia should still be on the market.  How many more need to die to prove a point to the FDA and Drs who insist on continuing prescribing Avandia.

Side Effects: Been taking Avandia for 6 mths now.  I have experienced a significant weight gain and I am already considered obese.  My feet are swollen and hurting even though I take Gabapentin (Nuronten).  I have decreased energy and feel too tired to even walk.  I have suffered migrane-type headaches in the morning. After taking this drug for two months_ I was diagnosed with high blood pressure.  A month ago_ I had a bad respiratory infection and when I went to the hospital_ I had an irregular heartbeat.  This drug is very scary and I did not put two and two together until I read this website due to the increased media attention.  I am requesting a medication next week on my next doctor's appt.  By being overweight_ I already have enough problems.

I felt Avandia helped overcome resistance to insulin allowing me to use less Humolog than would otherwise be the case. Recently however I've noticed that my use of Humolog is up_ so apparently the drug is not working as well as it did for the first few years. For the first year and a half to two years I didn't notice any side affects_ then_ about a year and a half ago I started experiencing swelling in my feet that has gradually gotten worse and now my legs are also quite swollen. Over the past year I've put on almost 50 pounds and couldn't understand what had changed to make this happen. For the past six months I have also started experiencing upper respiratory problems. I was very very surprised when I found this web site and read the reports from all those people that have experienced the same side affects. My doctor just told me to stop taking the drug to see how I do without it.
Comments: I never suspected this drug was possibly a problem_ I took it for almost two years with no noticeable problems - then all of a sudden my problems started and I had no clue why_ now I think it was this drug. I look forward to seeing how I do off this drug_ which I only stopped taking one day ago.

Side Effects: I have Irregularity of heart beat.  My blood sugar is very unstable.  Sometimes high_ sometimes low. I have muscle pain.  I find it hard to walk.  Thinning of hair.
None that I know of.
Comments: Added when the metformin I had previously taken wasn't enough.  Took a while but with a later addition of glyburide my glucose levels have come down significantly.  Not sure how much of that is the Avandia though.

Side Effects: First_ almost an 80-pound weight gain.  That was followed by anemia_ and then edema in lower legs.  I have no energy_ am tired all the time and what used to be daily activities are now beyond my ability to do.  Just getting out of my chair seems to be a major job_ and that was not my normal lifestyle 3 years ago when I started taking this medicine.
Comments: My doctor has not taken me off Avandia yet; as a matter of fact_ he hasn't even mentioned the excessive weight gain_ the tiredness or the edema.  So yes_ I am looking for a new family doctor!  I don't believe that the advantages of taking Avandia even begin to outweigh the disadvantages.

Side Effects: fluid around the wall of the heart_ tired blocked in one artuy _contuios fluid _and then the fluid left after 6 weeks after taken off this medaction had no prombles.... has any one had any of these prombles
edema and weight gain
Comments: Taking avandia for 8 yrs_4mg._2x a day... Last yr. had swelling in ankles and legs and gained 40 lbs. Dr. cut me back to 2mg._ once a day and 5 mg. glipzide. Swelling gone_ went on glycemic index diet and lost 20 lbs._ and still losing.

Side Effects: Last year went for a physical and had to have a ekg  very erratic heartbeat.  Dr didn't remove me from avandia but I decided to cut the dosage in half.  Heart beat seemed to have improved. Recently started the Neil Bernard regimen of  reversing diabetes the natural way.. essentially this is a vegan diet with low fat -the real culprit. Dramatic lowering of blood sugar from AM high 200s and low 300s to middle 100s in am before meds and excercise--after meds and excercise (swimming) a mile) sugar goes down to below 100.  very pleased-- will now stop all avandia in light of the news today. !!!
Comments: I have had suspicions about avandia and its lack of safety since I started using the drug.  I'm convinced this is a dangerous drug_ and that diet alone with glyberide will accomplish the same thing without side effects.  diet and excercise is all important for type II. Dr. knows only one  game and thats to give a pill.  Take care of yourself and be your own best Dr. The makers of this drug should be prosecuted and the feds repriAmanded. Obviously this is one more proof that the Food and Drug Adminsitration operates at the pleasure of the drug companies and not in the interest of protecting the public.  I hope there is a class action suit. I dont like my life being played with at all and this isn't going to go away.

Side Effects: sick from the start and stayed on this beacuse it was a great drug i was told
Comments: I had a  problrm and went off Avendia after a year i gain 50 Lbs and had a blockeg  in   iliac Avetrry(R) and that was done in 8/23 /05  And now three more stent in my Arterys   I belive that this med has given my heart Problrm now it in the News   Some one will maybe hea WHAT I BEEN SAYING WHEN I WAS TAKING THIS DRUD  i am 64 years young and my life style had to change. my drug bill became one of my SS checks for heart med

Side Effects: Weight gain_ water gain_ did o.k. on blood sugar_ but not in the morning.  Is not consistent.

while hospitalized I was administered Avandia as a protocol medication. The clear fact is that it should never be given to someone who previously had congestive heart failure. After two years_ I began having adverse reactions: Swollen feet_ edema_ peripheral neuropathy_ extreme difficulty breathing (very low oxygen saturation - 68%)_ sluggishness_ can't walk_ extreme weight gain_ hair loss_ almost died from lack of oxygen.
Comments: Only way to stop symptoms was to stop taking Avandia_ and to detoxify my body. Look into detox with oil swishing_ best method for me. I was able to recover my breathing within a two week period. Was on supplemental oxygen at the time. It took taking all this information to my Pulmonary doctor_ who recognized the problem with my breathing and had previously stated that I would never recover nor be able to take me off the oxygen. When he saw the side effects_ and the documentation on Avandia_ he was shocked. Was also surprised when I came in without the oxygen. He ran tests_ and is now recommending the detox to his patients.

Side Effects: Highs and lows in blood sugar levels. Has anyone experienced lymphodema in the stomach? I have large "blisters"_ skin is turning hard and am gaining weight in girth. Can hardly walk because of the extra weight.
Comments: Is this worth it?

Side Effects: I have had severe weight gain.  Within one year I have gone from a 16 to a size 22_ all while taking aerobics and watching what I eat and drink.  I was having menstrual bleeding almost on a daily basis.  The nurse practitioner thought my hormones were out of wack and told me I needed an IUD.  With that I gained 16 pounds in 6 months.  After having that removed_ I still can't lose weight despite the fact that I am still taking aerobics and cut out sodas and other fats.  It seems that I am just continuing to gain weight with this drug.  I have also just recently started having chest pains.  The doctor did a EKG though and found that my heart is okay.
Comments: The only good thing is that my glucose did come down and I don't have the craving for sweets like I used to. Do I really think that it is worth all that? Not really.  I think there are some good herbal medicines to take like Bitter Melon.

Side Effects: Extreme hair loss_ no weight loss
Comments: Asked doctor for an alternative because of extreme hair loss. Hair is coming out in hand fulls. My hair was very thick and plentiful. Now I have bald spots. It did low blood sugars. Hope new medicine stops the hair loss and still controls the sugar; scary. Weight has not come off easily. I work out 5 times a week_ stay on a controlled yet healty diet_ and drink plenty of water. I was loosing about .3 lbs per week. Doctor said this was good considering it is a weight gain medicine. No other side effects.

Side Effects: My side effects set in during 3rd month of 8mg treatment daily. Heart rate skyrocketed_ woke me up at 3 a.m. with 115 HR! I went to doctor and reminded her I was a PCOS patient (undiagnosed) and this could be too high of a dosage?  At first I'd lost weight and was feeling great_ then in February_ I ovulated_ gained weight (popped a button off my jeans!) and started to have blood pressure/HR problems_ fatigue_ nasty attitude due to "strain." We'll have to see how this plays out.
Comments: I called a pharmacist and took only 4 mg of Avandia along with 5 mg. of glipizide...BP going down_ HR dropping:  in ONE DAY!  This is touch and go.  I think it is a very good drug...I was in sugar range of 360 in December...it was 101 on Feb. 23 and 147 Feb. 26.

Side Effects: took avandia for a year and half filled up with fluid and couldnt breathe felt like i was dying. went to cardiologist and immediatly took me off avandia. gave me very potent water pills and a heart drug. now dr gave me actose and i am so scared it will do the same. tried the new pill januvia and got a terrible sore throat.

Upper respiratory infection and extremely painful muscle spasms in chest. Headaches. Painful swelling in both upper arms to the extent of almost total loss of movement.  Avandia is 4mg daily along with 2000mg metformin and 11mg glyburide.  hypoglycemia often with 1.2 being the lowest.  Just had glyburide lowered to 10mg 2 days before submitting this sugars are between 4.5 and 7 even with the lozenges i've been using because of the dry mouth and throat_ also lost 10 lbs_ which is good and not a complaint at all.
Comments: I am certain it caused fibromyalgia pain to grow in intensity. I "used" to only take 4_ 200 mg of ibuprophen daily to control that pain but am now on prescription for codiene and antibiotics.  I see the dr tomorrow 01/31/07 and will definitely request to go off of avandia. I have a high level of pain tolerance "normally" and find that I am getting depressed because of the increased and more constant pain.

Side Effects: In July 2006 I went to personal physician and kidney speciallist. At that time I was suffering from Swelling of the feet_  ankles and legs_ extreme sluggishness_ and heavy feeling in legs up to mid thigh. I was put on Lasix_ 40 mg/day. Condition continue to worsen so that by 12/25/06 I suffered from extreme fatigue as well as bilateral kidney pain and pain in the groin area as well as muscle soreness  in thighs. Read the side effects listed here 2 days after Christmas and immediately stopped taking 4mg/day of avandia. Starting 1/12/07 have also put myself on a no carbohydrate diet. Have lost 10 pounds altogether and feel much better. I have none of the symptoms that I listed above. None. I may tell my doctor this when i see him in March. I may also experiment with stopping the Lasix.
swollen feet_ painful foot joints_ higher blood sugar_ severe muscle pain
Comments: This drug made me feel awful and didn't lower my sugar. It seems I got almost all the side effects_ which hurt and made my life miserable_ since I dance and was unable to.

Side Effects: I have been on 8mgs. for 3 years and during that period experience a 20 lb. weight gain and water retention especially in my legs.  It was so bad I could hardly walk.  There was a mix up in my insurance and I was without the drug for 3 weeks.  What a difference!  I started working out 3 times a week_ am losing weight_ I'm eating correctly_ I was happy until I started it again last week.  My quality of life has again gone down hill with the nausea_ etc.  I am going to discontine the drug and continue to watch what I eat and see what happens with the next A1C test.
Comments: I was on Avandia only because I can't take Glucophage which I guess is the drug of choice.

Side Effects: swelling of the feet and ankles_ sluggishness_ heavy feeling in legs_ heart flutters_ irregular heart beat and extreme fatigue.  I cut my dose from8mg to 4 and have noted improvement to some degree. I may try to lower bl sugar by weight loss to stop altogether. I also noticed bad infections with mrsi methicillin resistant staff infections_ for which leviquin was adequate to eliminate and which was a result of abnormally high blood sugar. I'm getting more afraid of avandia _ it is no longer getting the job done and its negative effects appear to be cumulative.
Comments: have there been any known deaths from avandia due to heart irregularities.

Side Effects: NONE
Comments: Outstanding result of treatment using Avandia + single injection triamcinolone.  12 years of topical treatment (Elocon_ Dermol creams) had only resulted in progressive total-body psoriasis.  I cannot speak too highly of Avandia/triamcinolone as a "Deliverance" from the Hell which is psoriasis.

Side Effects: I went Blind-20/400 vision
Comments: Notice--if you know anyone Blind that takes the Drugs-Actos or Avandia-Please spread the wordTHESE DRUGS CAN CAUSE YOU TO GO BLINDIn Jan 2000 I was prescribed 15 mil per day Actos-in a few months it was raised to 25 mil per day-in Oct 01 it was raised to 35 mil-in Aug 01 I had a light stroke in NOV 01-vision got very blurry. My Dr sent me to a Dr of Ophthalmology_ Tulsa_ OK-the Dr stated_ we can fix this_ you got to me in time. We started Lasers_ 3 treatments in left eye & one treatment in right eye_ vision got worse. Now I had Cystoids Macular Edema. Shots in the eyes 2 in right & 4 in left of Kenalog. About July 03 my medication was changed from Actos to Avandia. Since Kenalog can worsen cataracts_ I had cataract surgery on left eye Dec 24th 03-it was wonderful I could hardly waite to get right eye done. Jan 04 we done cataract surgery on right eye--My vision was 20-20-BUT-only for a few days!! The swelling had come back. On Jan 6th of this year I was watching the l

Side Effects: started on Avandia 2mg twice daily [1month]. I began suffering from triedness ; fatigue; muscle pains and shortness of breath.I go to gym twice a week - and I am exhausted after a "light" workout.
Comments: sugar levels are well controlled with avandia and diet and keeping fit [but keeping fit is getting harder to do - due to the fatigue]

Side Effects: On it for approx. 4 yrs (took .6mg three rimes/day (heavy dose)  I have no doubt it caused........  1. swollen legs_ ankles_ and feet.    2. weight gain
Comments: Had to get by on ONLY AVANDIA (anaphlactic shock from Glucophage)--Tookapprox a month to really "kick in" Then kept sugar nostly in middle 100s. After first year--developed BREATHLESSNESS which has become extremely worse with next two yrs.  In hospital for minor surgery one yr ago (unrelated).  CT CHEST_ Echocardiogram_ heart monitoring--esentially normal.  Since then-CUT Dosage down to .4MG EACH AM AND pm.  ALL LEG-ANKLE-FEET EDEMA-GONE COMLETELY. oNLY HALF AS BREATHLESS NOW. nOW i AM READY TO FIND SOMETHING ELSE-SO i CAN GET RID OF THE BREATHLESSNRSS. question---aNYONE ELSE HAVING bREATHING PROBLEMS??            a

Side Effects: Initially mild swelling of legs_ then gradually increased to moderate swelling. Tiredness of legs. Increased infections
Comments: Blood glucose control was good HbA1c last was 6.25mmol/L. I did experience elevations in sugar in am but dividing 8mg into twice daily 4mg helped. GP has suspended my Avandia for a month and put me on Glucophage 500mg three times daily. I see no noticeable changes in blood sugars on Glucophage and my ankle swelling has disappeared. Since holding my Avandia (5 days ago) I have lost 3lbs in weight I assume this was from retained fluid. I am seriously considering not re-starting Avandia after the month is up_ especially if there is no difference while using Glucophage. The other consideration too is the vast difference in drug cost for Avandia vs. lucophage

Side Effects: Swelling of the ankles.  Weight gain.
Comments: I was taking 8 mg per day Avandia for several years_ along with glyburide and metformin.  Two years ago I began taking insulin_ and dropped the glyburide.  Last week my endocrinologist finally agreed my ankles were swollen (they had been swollen for years)_ and told me to cut back to Avanadia 4 mg/day.  I am hoping I can eliminate the Avandia completely and just increase the insulin a bit.  The only disadvantage might be loss of the benefit to serum lipid levels due to Avandia.

Side Effects: Swelling of ankles_ no weight gain.  (I do not have diabetes_ perhaps that explains why no weight gain.)  Have been on the medication for 18 months.  It worked great at first_ but now it hardly helps at all.  My doctor warned me it would have a diminishing effect_ and I would have to increase dosage now_ which I am reluctant to do.  Has anyone tried discontinuing Avandia and then restarting it to see if full effects can be regained?  Also_ see new health warnings re Avandia's effect on vision.  (Google "Avandia vision" for results re this.)
Comments: New medications similar to Avandia are in the pipeline: Acomplia is one_ though it is still not approved by the FDA.  (Google Acomplia AND "insulin resistance" for more info.)

Side Effects: Blurred Vision_ Swollen Ankles
Comments: Took about 6 - 8 weeks to begin working a bit.

Side Effects: Bad diarrhea. And I mean BAD. Assume it's doing what it should but since I've just started_ it's hard to know.

I take 8 mg. to control diabetes. It has worked well for my diabetes without causing hypoglycemia like some other medications. Avandia is also in a class of drugs that is used to treat PCOS (polycystic ovarian syndrome) It has caused me to start ovulating again. As I'm 54_ this would have been great have I been 20 or 30 years younger. : (

Have been on Avandia 4 mg twice a day as well as Amaryl and have gained 15 pounds in 2 years.  My legs ache and I have had increased infections since beginning Avandia especially in my teeth and the bones of my teeth which I take meticulous care of.
Comments: I have my reservations about this drug especially in the area of causing infections.

Side Effects: Have been on Avandia 4 mg twice a day as well as Amaryl and have gained 15 pounds in 2 years.  My legs ache and I have had increased infections since beginning Avandia especially in my teeth and the bones of my teeth which I take meticulous care of.
Comments: I have my reservations about this drug especially in the area of causing infections.

Side Effects: No side effects except weight gain that stays despite efforts to minimalize caloric intake
Comments: Seems to do the job.

Reason: type 2 diabetes as adjunct to glybu
Side Effects: swelling of feet and ankles which is sporadic but progressively worse. also have begun to have irregular heartbeat and symptoms of weakness _fatigue_ weight gain and heart flutters from time to time.  there has been a noticeabe and dramatic increase in blood pressure after taking drug in the morning. I'm seriously considering taking myself off this medicine just to see how much good it is doing with lowering sugar whcih is still a problem and to see if the swelling _heart flutters and weight gain are related to its use.
Comments: If alcohol and avandia in combination cause a drop in blood sugar why not use less avandia and allow a glass of wine or two especially in those having trouble keeping their suger down?

Side Effects: Severe swelling of feet and lower legs_ up to knees.  Increased pain sensitivity in feet.  Increased hunger.  Also experienced anemia (a known side effect of Avandia).  Ceased Avandia after 90 days.
I do seem to be more hungry and the few pounds I'd recently lost have come back.
Comments: I have more energy_ and my blood sugar dropped quickly.

Side Effects: Slight foot/ankle swelling_ hypoglycemia for the first few months.
Comments: Avandia did reduce my blood glucose significantly_ and the side effects faded over a few months.  I am taking this in concert with Glucophage_ as "Avandamet." I have not gained any weight since beginning this drug_ however_ I also moved from a desk job to a farm job_ which might also explain the 12% reduction in body fat.I am beginning menopause at 46. I am concerned my doctor did not mention to me the increased chance of pregnancy in women of my age and sexual development.  He's going to hear about it soon!

Side Effects: Experienced constant_ unsatisfiable hunger; weight gain_ change in monthly hormone activity_ skin breakouts. It turned out I did not need the medication after all of that - I have experienced shortness of breath since stopping avandia_ as well as breast swelling.
Comments: Avandia was prescribed to me to improve insulin receptor efficiency before dr. was certain of reason for high glucose intolerance from a glucose tolerance test. Then dr. took me back off saying I didn't need it after all. He'd said there would be no side effects_ but that was untrue.

Side Effects: none
Comments: I have not seen any lowering of my blood sugar levels. However I have only been on this for 10 days.

Side Effects: Weight gain_ shortness of breath_ fatigue_ lower left leg and foot edema
I have split the original 8 mg. dose into 2X 4 mg. to avoid recurrent spells of Hypoglycaemia. Otherwise it works well but not so well as the discontiued Rezulin.
increased hunger_ swollen ankles.  Has anyone else gotten increased hunger/appetite from this?
Comments: When I first started taking this only noticed a slight decrease in the time it takes for my blood sugar to drop.  Just learned that fluid retention is related to drug.  Tight socks hurt now.  My sugars jumped from stress and thought this would complement my diet and exercise routine.  Not really.  (8mg daily_ 24 BMI)

Side Effects: Swelling of feet; feet also became hypersensitive and painful
Comments: quite effective in reducing blood sugar_ but abovementioned side effects forced discontinuation of drug.

Side Effects: Have become partly Impotent
Comments: Glucose levels have dropped and i have more energy

Side Effects: For first 2 weeks experienced nausea which passed. Main drawback is it makes you feel hungry all the time.
Comments: Avandia works great for glucose control when used in combination with Glucophage.

Side Effects: no problems
Comments: i really like avandia
